item.title: Intel worker accused of aiding terrorists
item.description: The Justice Department charges engineer Mike Hawash, who has been in solitary confinement since March 20, with conspiracy to levy war against America and of supporting terror groups.

item.title: Commentary: Breaking the digital music logjam
item.description: The iTunes Music Store will raise the bar for digital music under Windows and change the industry, but it won't get Apple out of its 5 percent ghetto in the PC business.

item.title: Off the hype meter
item.description: Industry watcher Jon Oltsik offers his nominations for technology categories in which the elevation of hype has become an art form.

item.title: Sweet Semel of success
item.description: After two years as leader of Yahoo, CEO Terry Semel is silencing naysayers with the results of his low-key approach.

item.title: Apple's music: Evolution, not revolution
item.description: For all the glitz surrounding the unveiling of Apple's new music service, a quick look suggests that it's a solid, but hardly revolutionary, addition to the market.
